title: Toyota Fortuner price increases by up to Rs 68,000
description: Shortly after the launch of the Toyota Fortuner mild-hybrid variants, the Japanese brand has trimmed the SUV’s line-up, listed separate prices for a new Platinum White Pearl exterior finish, and increased prices by up to Rs 68,000. This price hike affects petrol and diesel Fortuners, as well as the Legender variants. html:
Toyota has also discontinued select variants of the Fortuner and Legender and has added a new Platinum White Pearl exterior finish.

Shortly after the launch of the Toyota Fortuner mild-hybrid variants, the Japanese brand has trimmed the SUV’s line-up, listed separate prices for a new Platinum White Pearl exterior finish, and increased prices by up to Rs 68,000. This price hike affects petrol and diesel Fortuners, as well as the Legender variants.

  1. Toyota Fortuner Neo Drive variants replace diesel 4x4 AT
  2. Fortuner diesel prices hiked by Rs 40,000
  3. Fortuner and Legender mild-hybrid variants don’t get ventilated seats

*Platinum White Pearl exterior colour available for Rs 15,000 more

Mild-hybrid Fortuner variants have effectively replaced diesel 4x4 AT variants

While Toyota introduced the Fortuner and Legender mild-hybrid variants – badged as Neo Drive 48V – just last week, now it has discontinued the diesel 4x4 AT variants, bringing the total number of variants on offer down to nine from 11. As the above table shows, price for the sole Fortuner petrol variant has increased by Rs 68,000, while all diesel variants have seen a Rs 40,000 hike.

Toyota Fortuner mild-hybrid price and features

Gets 360-degree camera and terrain modes but misses out on ventilated seats

The mild-hybrid Fortuner variants cost Rs 2 lakh more than the diesel 4x4 AT variants they effectively replace. Along with the 48V tech that enables the fuel-saving engine start-stop function, these mild-hybrid variants are also equipped with a 360-degree camera, a wireless smartphone charger and terrain modes – Mud, Sand, Rock, Dirt and Snow. However, they lack ventilated front seats, which are available on the standard Fortuner.
